law.catch_line: Criminal possession of forged instrument in the first degree.

text.section: A person is guilty of criminal possession of a forged instrument in the first degree when, with knowledge that it is forged and with intent to defraud, deceive or injure another, he utters or possesses any forged instrument of a kind specified in KRS 516.020.
Criminal possession of a forged instrument in the first degree is a Class C felony.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 136, effective January 1, 1975.
